channels.summary: Academic-focused sharing of OSINT-related articles, labs, and programs, plus discussion of AI survey manipulation and US research politics.

highlights.title: Reuters Institute – Israel–Gaza war and the limits of open-source reporting
highlights.details: Article on how the Israel–Hamas war showcased both the strengths and constraints of open-source reporting, relevant for teaching OSINT methodology and verification limits.

highlights.title: AI agent that evades online survey bot-detection
highlights.details: 404 Media write-up of a research project where an AI agent evaded online survey bot-detection 99.8% of the time, raising concerns about the integrity of survey-based social science.

highlights.title: Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab – Utrecht University
highlights.details: Shared as a key academic lab using open-source methods for global justice investigations, potentially useful for students and collaborative research.

highlights.title: Queen’s Belfast programme linked to GLAN
highlights.details: Programme at Queen’s University Belfast related to open-source and legal accountability work, relevant for those combining OSINT and law.

highlights.title: Nature coverage of Trump-era actions impacting UCLA research
highlights.details: Nature article referenced in context of claims that mathematician Terence Tao’s research is being affected by political actions against UCLA, illustrating political risk to academic work.

highlights.title: Stage Talks with Bellingcat – RSS feed for recordings
highlights.details: Podcast feed shared as a way to access recordings of Bellingcat’s Stage Talks, useful for integrating real-world OSINT case studies into teaching.

highlights.title: LARB review of Antoine Bousquet’s “The Eye of War”
highlights.details: Article on ‘military perception from the telescope to the drone’, useful for theory reading lists on imaging, targeting and surveillance.

mentions: Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism
Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab
GLAN (Global Legal Action Network, by context)
Westwood (AI survey study author, by context)

channels.summary: Weekly server updates, Stage Talk announcements and recordings, new investigations, challenges, and community/process announcements.

highlights.title: Upcoming Stage Talk with Mareike Vitt on funding open-source investigations
highlights.details: Announcement of a Stage Talk featuring Bellingcat’s fundraiser on practical ways to finance open-source investigations and research collectives.

highlights.title: Bellingcat DC federal enforcement investigation
highlights.details: Server update highlighting Bellingcat’s work verifying 42 federal agent encounters in Washington, DC within a month of federal control, including interactions with DC police and escalatory traffic stops.

highlights.title: Stage Talk – Identifying Explosive Ordnance
highlights.details: Recording of a Stage Talk on different types of explosive ordnance and current usage in conflicts, now available as an edited podcast episode.

highlights.title: Stage Talk – Open Source Munitions Portal
highlights.details: Stage Talk episode on the Open Source Munitions Portal, explaining how to use the portal to identify and research munitions in conflict zones.

highlights.title: YouTube investigation – decades-old murder, mafia, gamblers, and pigeons
highlights.details: Video by Bellingcat researcher Peter Barth detailing how open-source methods can crack decades-old murder cases involving organised crime.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Challenges platform
highlights.details: New sets of OSINT challenges released on Bellingcat’s challenge site, with encouragement to share workflows and content derived from solving them.

highlights.title: Investigation into shadow fleet grain shipment from occupied Crimea to Saudi Arabia
highlights.details: Announcement of a maritime OSINT investigation (with Lloyd’s List) identifying another country importing grain from a sanctioned Crimean port using Russia’s shadow fleet.

highlights.title: Stage Talk with DoubleThink Lab’s Jasper Hewitt on FIMI
highlights.details: Upcoming event focused on monitoring inauthentic accounts and conducting deep-dive Foreign Information Manipulation and Interference investigations.

highlights.title: Guidance on Epstein-related discussion – dedicated forum post
highlights.details: New dedicated, mute-able forum thread created for Epstein-related content as a harm-reduction measure, replacing the previous general news channel approach.

highlights.title: Call for wildlife and environment OSINT investigations
highlights.details: Bellingcat invites open-source wildlife and environmental investigations (not only from journalists) that can meet rigorous fact-checking and editorial standards.

highlights.title: Investigation of ICE raids and use of force in Illinois
highlights.details: Announcement of a Bellingcat and Evident Media piece analyzing ICE raids and police use of force at immigration protests in Illinois.

highlights.title: Stage Talks on suspicious ships and maritime anomalies
highlights.details: Recap and link to a Stage Talk with Christian (maritime researcher) on suspicious vessels operating in international waters and investigative techniques used.

channels.summary: Light but focused geolocation activity around Chinese balloon/airship infrastructure and an island comparison task off Myanmar.

highlights.title: Chinese airship/balloon hangar and mooring pole sites
highlights.details: A member flags remote Chinese locations with airship/balloon hangars and mooring poles as potential targets for geolocation and further OSINT mapping.

highlights.title: Island comparison geolocation task off Myanmar
highlights.details: Shared Discord message link inviting users to compare two islands off Myanmar’s coast as a practical geolocation challenge.

channels.summary: Robust sharing of art-crime resources: cyber vulnerabilities at major museums, open archival databases, law-enforcement operations, and policy setbacks in cultural property protection.

highlights.title: Theft at the Louvre caused by weak surveillance password
highlights.details: Article describing how the Louvre’s surveillance system used the password “louvre”, triggering a security crisis and highlighting cyber risks in cultural heritage institutions.

highlights.title: Harvard Law School Library – complete digitized Nuremberg Trials collection
highlights.details: Newly available, fully searchable English-language digitization of evidentiary documents and transcripts from all 13 Nuremberg Trials, valuable for WWII-era provenance and claims research.

highlights.title: Europol-coordinated crackdown on cultural goods trafficking in Bulgaria
highlights.details: Report on a coordinated operation that led to 35 arrests and dismantled a criminal network trafficking cultural goods across Europe and beyond.

highlights.title: IFAR publications now free on Internet Archive
highlights.details: Historic, formerly paywalled publications of the International Foundation for Art Research are now digitized and free, providing rich pre-digital data on attribution, provenance, and art market history.

highlights.title: U.S. disbands cultural property investigations unit
highlights.details: Denver Post article on Homeland Security’s Cultural Property, Art and Antiquities program being reassigned to immigration enforcement work, weakening U.S. cultural heritage protection.

highlights.title: U.S. withdrawal from ICCROM
highlights.details: Discussion of the Trump administration pulling out of ICCROM, criticized for undermining international cultural property preservation; includes ICCROM’s LinkedIn response.

mentions: Cultural Property, Art and Antiquities program
ICCROM (International Centre for the Study of the Preservation and Restoration of Cultural Property)
ARCA (Association for Research into Crimes Against Art)

channels.summary: Mixed regional discussion including China politics, antisemitism discourse, Indonesian repression of activists, and moderation of sensitive OSINT content.

highlights.title: NYT report on Chinese general linked to Tiananmen Square
highlights.details: Shared New York Times article on a Chinese general tied to the 1989 Tiananmen Square crackdown, relevant to political-military profiling.

highlights.title: Distinguishing antisemitism from criticism of Israel
highlights.details: Conversation invoking Neturei Karta and Satmar Hasidim to argue that criticism of Israeli state policies should not be automatically equated with antisemitism.

highlights.title: Tempo English – intimidation of Indonesian activists and influencers
highlights.details: Compilation of intimidation acts against Indonesian activists and influencers in 2025, useful for human-rights trend analysis.

highlights.title: Amnesty report on arbitrary arrests in Indonesia’s 2025 protests
highlights.details: Amnesty International–reported figure of 5,538 arbitrary arrests and abuses during 2025 protests in Indonesia, shared for regional human-rights monitoring.

channels.summary: Technical OSINT tips on ADS-B tools, flight-plan analysis, and safety reporting, along with examples of public aviation tracking being used for investigative work.

highlights.title: CPA SkyCircles – closest-approach visualization
highlights.details: Demonstration of https://cpa.skycircl.es loading a specific KML track to visualize resolution advisories; users are guided to enable position reports and inspect the closest approach.

highlights.title: AirNav Radar + ADS-B Exchange workflow for blocked flights
highlights.details: Tip that a subscribed AirNav Radar app can show the filed flight plan route for many flights, including some ‘blocked’ ones; combined with ADS-B Exchange, this reveals origin, destination, routing, and aircraft details.

highlights.title: ProPublica – SpaceX launches and airline safety
highlights.details: Investigation into how Starship test launches and associated FAA decisions intersect with airline safety over Florida and the Caribbean.

highlights.title: Flightradar24 social media coverage of Venezuelan MoD flight
highlights.details: FR24 tweet (via vxtwitter) referenced in context of tracking a flight linked to Venezuela’s defense minister Vladimir Padrino López.

channels.summary: Only a brief remark on the Kinzhal missile’s susceptibility to spoofing and its propaganda use; no substantive investigative content in this period.
Focused discussion on Central Asian military mapping, disinformation narratives about biolabs, and Russian troop movements in Armenia.

highlights.title: Oxus Society – interactive map of Tajik military units
highlights.details: Shared visualization mapping Tajikistan’s military units, valuable as an open-source reference for regional force structure.

highlights.title: Upcoming interactive database of 620+ Uzbek military facilities
highlights.details: Teaser for an almost-finished interactive product mapping more than 620 military facilities across Uzbekistan, expanding OSINT coverage of Central Asian armed forces.

highlights.title: DFRLab report on ‘biolabs’ disinformation in Armenia
highlights.details: Discussion of a Digital Forensic Research Lab report noting how Russia’s Ukraine ‘biolabs’ narrative is being repurposed in Armenia, now implicating CDC, USAID and scientific conferences.

highlights.title: Euromaidan Press – Russian troop buildup in Armenia
highlights.details: Article on Moscow accelerating troop deployments in Armenia amid rising tensions with Azerbaijan, relevant to regional security analysis.

highlights.title: Clarification on peace deal wording – ‘initialed’ vs ‘signed’
highlights.details: Member corrects misinterpretations of a peace agreement by noting it was ‘initialed’ rather than ‘signed’, highlighting the importance of precise legal language in conflict reporting.

mentions: CDC (U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)

channels.summary: Channel remains in use for logging completed geolocations, including a new residential damage case in Kherson oblast.

highlights.title: ID 2547 – Kozats’ke & Vesele, Kherson residential damage
highlights.details: Geolocation of imagery from Suspilne Kherson to coordinates near 46.7973, 33.3547, documenting residential damage in Kozats’ke/Vesele with Google Maps links.

channels.summary: Meta-discussion about Bellingcat’s work and infrastructure: Toolkit anniversary, Stage Talk episode releases, awards, challenges, and new distribution channels.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Online Investigation Toolkit – 1-year anniversary
highlights.details: Reminder that the overhauled Toolkit has been live for a year; it aggregates vetted open-source tools with use cases, guidance and community-written reviews.

highlights.title: Stage Talks with Bellingcat – multiple new episodes
highlights.details: Several Stage Talk podcast episodes shared, including ones on tracking a lost Brueghel with Arthur Brand, US immigration raids, far-right fashion, suspicious ships, and mapping Central Asia’s armed forces.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Challenges platform promotion
highlights.details: Direct link to the challenge platform, encouraging users to sharpen OSINT skills on curated puzzles.

highlights.title: Bellingcat WhatsApp channel
highlights.details: Announcement that Bellingcat now maintains a WhatsApp updates channel for people who prefer messaging apps over social media feeds.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Annual Report 2024
highlights.details: Shared PDF of the 2024 annual report, outlining investigations, impact, and future lessons.

highlights.title: Open-source extremist identification project wins journalism award
highlights.details: Congratulations to community members whose open-source extremist identification work was recognized by the Online News Association awards.

highlights.title: Patreon-exclusive podcast on Bellingcat’s volunteer community
highlights.details: New Patreon episode giving a behind-the-scenes look at how the volunteer community operates and contributes to investigations.

channels.summary: Strong focus on the infrastructure of online manipulation: scientific work on the ‘manipulation economy’, platform algorithm biases, fake organizing accounts, and mil-intel info-ops.

highlights.title: Science paper – Mapping the online manipulation economy
highlights.details: Thread and DOI shared for a Science article arguing that treating digital manipulation as a market helps improve trust and safety responses.

highlights.title: Sky News – How X boosts right-wing and hateful accounts
highlights.details: Study-backed article on how Elon Musk’s X platform algorithmically amplifies British right-wing and hateful accounts.

highlights.title: Leah Greenberg warns of fake protest organizer harvesting RSVPs
highlights.details: Bluesky post highlighting a bogus organizer collecting signups, illustrating how mobilization spaces are exploited for data harvesting or disruption.

highlights.title: GDIT Danish linguist job likely tied to SOCOM info ops in Greenland
highlights.details: Job listing analyzed as a U.S. Special Operations Command information operations role targeting Danish media and Greenlandic audiences.

highlights.title: @comment_dissector (Threads) – copy/paste narrative tracking
highlights.details: Account recommended for tracking trending, copy-pasted information operations and propaganda narratives across Threads.

highlights.title: Sora watermark placement in AI-generated videos
highlights.details: Observation that the Sora watermark typically appears where text overlays are in the referenced clip, relevant for provenance checks of synthetic media.

channels.summary: Environmental OSINT updates including the shutdown of a key NASA fire tool, climate impacts, infrastructure risks, and agrochemical safety research.

highlights.title: NASA FIRMS – data updates halted due to funding
highlights.details: Notice that NASA’s FIRMS fire monitoring site is no longer being updated because of federal funding shortfalls, a major gap for wildfire and burn-scar monitoring.

highlights.title: Guardian – mosquitoes found in Iceland as climate warms
highlights.details: Article about mosquitoes being detected in Iceland for the first time, underscoring northward expansion of disease vectors under climate change.

highlights.title: Washington Post – U.S. dams sinking and associated risks
highlights.details: Coverage of aging U.S. dam infrastructure sinking and the risks posed, with archived copy for paywall-free access.

highlights.title: Retraction of seminal glyphosate safety paper
highlights.details: Post sharing a Mastodon thread on the retraction of a 25-year-old paper that had underpinned claims of glyphosate’s safety, citing concerns over authorship and misrepresented contributions.

highlights.title: Canteen menu swap reduces carbon footprint by 30%
highlights.details: YouTube short showing that simply swapping dishes in a canteen menu weekly cut the menu’s carbon footprint by around 30%, illustrating the effect of subtle behavioral interventions.
